title: Persuasive Design Principles in Serious Games: Procedural Rhetoric and Ethical Framing

context.prior_knowledge: No prior experience with game design fundamentals or instructional technology applications
context.additional_context: A course for science professionals to enhance their ability to develop job-integrated simulations.

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply the three elements of procedural rhetoric (claim, evidence, logic) to game mechanics
Learners can evaluate ethical components (phronesis, arete, eunoia) in persuasive game design
Learners can apply persuasive game design principles to practical settings through case analyses of *McDonald's Videogame* and *ReDistricting Game*
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
